results.title: A Moomba Magic Moment
results.brief_description: It all started with my promotional photo and my girlfriend Gail Gordon, she entered me into the Moomba Quest, and the rest is history. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Moom
results.brief_description: Mum and I would laugh at how the Moomba festival was named after our deadly mooms. Moom refers to our bottoms. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Memories of a Birdman
results.brief_description: “My name is George Abel and it’s now thirty years since the idea of the Birdman Rally struck me.” A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Max's Story: Waterskiing on the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Craig Bellamy, Gordon Chisholm and Max Kirwin
results.brief_description: A story about Max Kirwin, who introduced waterskiing to the Melbourne Moomba Waterfest in 1956. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Memories of Moomba
results.brief_description: A selection of short films made in a Digital Storytelling workshop held to celebrate 50 years ofthe Moomba festival. The stories explore the history of the parade and life as a sun queen of moomba. It traces the history of the well known carnival family, and highlights the achievements of the key figures involved in the wild and wacky water events. Memories of Moomba was produced in collaboration with City of Melbourne and Melbourne Moomba Waterfest.

results.title: Quotes
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work features a group of rollerbladers displaying their moves, their falls and the tricks of their trade.

results.title: Going Solo
results.brief_description:
Through life experiences such as divorce, bereavement or never meeting the right soulmate we may find ourselves fifty plus and living on our own. For some in this situation a new partner is not what they crave, just the supportive friendship of those who understand.

Based on a series of interviews conducted with members of a Catholic Women’s solo group, this 36 min amateur documentary is a first time effort for the filmmaker and although the production values are at times questionable - the heart and soul of the women interviewed shine through making this a warm, often funny and inspirational account of life for a growing number of people in our community.

results.title: The good, the bad and the animated
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. This animated homage to Sergio Leone has the classic western ‘shootout’, between a cowboy in black and a cowboy in white. This town ain’t big enough for the both of them.
